item.name: WebProxy service is running
item.description: net.udp.listen is supported since Zabbix agent version 1.8.4.

item.name: DHCP service is running
item.description: net.udp.listen is supported since Zabbix agent version 1.8.4.

item.name: UDP NTP service is running
item.description: net.udp.listen is supported since Zabbix agent version 1.8.4.

item.name: SNMP service is running
item.description: net.udp.listen is supported since Zabbix agent version 1.8.4.

item.description: This Monitoring is supported Vyatta 6.5 R1 Zabbix agent version 2.0.5.

item.name: OpenVPN service is running
item.description: OLD KEY: net.udp.listen[1194] - Key was replaced because command "netstat" still shows the port as LISTEN even if closed in firewall rules. Using process method instead (custom, inside zabbix_agent.conf), which monitors the openvpn daemon.

item.name: IPSec service is running
item.description: OLD KEY: net.udp.listen[1194] - Key was replaced because command "netstat" still shows the port as LISTEN even if closed in firewall rules. Using process method instead (custom, inside zabbix_agent.conf), which monitors the openvpn daemon.

item.name: VRRP last transition (bond0)
VRRP status (bond0) - v2
VRRP status (bond0)

trigger_prototype.name: GRE peer {#GRE_PEER} is unreachable
trigger_prototype.description: GRE peer is not responding to ICMP (last 5 verifications)

trigger_prototype.name: GRE peer {#GRE_PEER} latency too high
trigger_prototype.description: GRE peer have latency > 100ms in the last 5 verifications

item_prototype.name: VPN peer $1 tunnel $2 RESET
item_prototype.description: Zabbix item will reset VPN tunnel only when its state is not "up"

trigger_prototype.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vpn_tunnel_status[{#VPN_PEER},{#VPN_TUNNEL}].last()}=3 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:process_status[pluto].last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=0
trigger_prototype.name: IPSec peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} is missing on BACKUP node

trigger_prototype.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vpn_tunnel_status[{#VPN_PEER},{#VPN_TUNNEL}].last()}=3 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=1
trigger_prototype.name: IPSec peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} is missing on MASTER node

trigger_prototype.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vpn_tunnel_status[{#VPN_PEER},{#VPN_TUNNEL}].max(#15)}=0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vpn_tunnel_status[{#VPN_PEER},{#VPN_TUNNEL}].min(#15)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: VPN Peer {#VPN_PEER} Tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} is down
trigger_prototype.description: Item collects data each 120s. Trigger evaluates last 3 values (7 minutes).

graph_prototype.name: VPN peer {#VPN_PEER} tunnel {#VPN_TUNNEL} - tunnel status (up/down history)

resource.name: Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Bar graph
Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Pie chart

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:process_status[pluto].last()}=0 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=1
trigger.name: IPSec service is down on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Will trigger when IPSec service is stopped on VRRP master

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:process_status[pluto].last()}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:vrrp_numStatus.last()}=0
trigger.name: IPSec service is up on VRRP BACKUP node {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Will trigger when IPSec is running on a VRRP BACKUP node

trigger.expression: {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:net.udp.listen[1701].last(#2)}=1 and {GTS-IS Template Vyatta 5400 - Zabbix:net.udp.listen[1701].last(#1)}=0
trigger.name: L2TP VPN service is down
trigger.description: Will trigger only when LAST value is 0 (not running) AND the value before was 1 (running)

trigger.name: OpenVPN service is down on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Will trigger only when LAST value is 0 (not running) AND the value before was 1 (running)

trigger.name: UDP NTP service is down on {HOST.NAME}

graph.name: Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Bar graph
Memory use ratio by vyatta processes Pie chart
